III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Sufficiency of staff.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126
Section (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency's program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 11/05/24, a youth was physically assaulted by other youth at
the facility. Youth did sustain injuries to include two black eyes.
Investigation Interviews
Complainant was interviewed on 11/12/2024 by phone.
Complainant does not have additional information.
Youth A was interviewed on 11/13/2024 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention. Youth A stated he was seated at a table with
Youth B in the common area watching television on Unit 3A.
Youth A stated youths ran out of the unit’s gym and started hitting
Youth B. Youth A stated he got up when he heard “skin hitting
skin”. Youth A stated a youth hit Youth A in the face and other
youths also started to hit him. Youth A stated he swung back in
self-defense. Youth A stated he and Youth B tried to run away
from the youths, but the youths cornered them separately. Youth
A stated staff tried to intervene and called for assistance. Youth A
stated a manager or supervisor arrived and moved Youth A and
Youth B off the unit into the vestibule. Youth A stated he did not
know why the physical altercations occurred, but it was odd when
earlier the youths in the gym asked him, Youth B and Youth C to
go to the gym. Youth A stated that was the first time they were
invited, but they did not go and stayed to themselves. Youth A
was observed with fading black eyes, minor swelling to his right
eye and healing scratch marks on his neck. Youth A stated he did
not witness Youth C getting physically assaulted.
2

Youth B was interviewed on 11/13/2024 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention. Youth B stated he was seated at a table with
Youth A in the common area watching television and Youth C sat
on the couch behind them. Youth B stated the other youths were
in the unit’s gym when a youth “snuck up” from behind and
punched Youth B in the head. Youth B stated he stood up and
saw youths hitting Youth A. Youth B stated youths continued to hit
Youth A and Youth B while staff intervened verbally and physically
to stop the physical altercations. Youth B stated assistance was
called and a staff in a white shirt took him and Youth A off the unit
for their safety. Youth B stated Youth A was injured and bleeding
from somewhere on his head. Youth B stated he did not know
Youth C was also involved in a physical altercation until he saw
Youth C on the medical unit. Youth B stated he did not know what
prompted the physical altercations. Youth B stated he, Youth A
and Youth C were new to the unit and kept to themselves. Youth
B stated his scratches and bruises have healed from this incident.
Youth C was interviewed on 11/26/2024 by phone because he
was discharged home on 11/07/2024. Youth C stated he got up
from watching television and reading his bible and a youth hit him
in the face. Youth C stated this physical altercation occurred
without warning and reason. Youth C stated earlier there was a
group of youths in the gym and they asked Youth A, Youth B and
Youth C to join them. Youth C stated this was the first time they
were invited to play basketball, but they turned it down. Youth C
stated multiple staff responded to the assistance call and a staff
directed him to go to the unit’s meeting room to avoid being hit by
youths. Youth C stated he received a bloody lip from this incident
and it healed without issue. Youth C denied knowing any of the
youths on the unit prior to being placed at Wayne County Juvenile
Detention.
Youth A, Youth B and Youth C were not able to provide specific
details in the physical altercations. They were not able to identify
the youths that assaulted them. They were not able to identify the
staff that intervened in the physical altercations.
Youth D was interviewed on 11/20/2024 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention. Youth D stated Youth C knew a physical
altercation was about to happen because Youth C talked about
Youth D’s deceased mother. Youth D stated he did not know
Youth C, but Youth C told him that they did. Youth D stated Youth
C asked Youth D to come out of the gym and fight. Youth D stated
Youth C walked towards him when Youth D exited the gym. Youth
D stated he swung first at Youth C and Youth C swung back.
3

Youth D stated he saw youths fighting Youth B in the common
area and stopped fighting Youth C. Youth D stated staff and
assistance tried to stop the physical altercations. Youth D stated
he did not recall the names of staff involved in this incident or how
they intervened.
Youth E was interviewed on 11/20/2024 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention. Youth E stated he was in the gym with several
youths that had tension with Youth B over a basketball game and
other petty issues. Youth E stated the youths in the gym planned
the physical altercations. Youth E stated he left the gym when he
heard punches, headed towards Youth B and started to hit Youth
B. Youth E stated he was not sure who engaged in a physical
altercation with Youth A and Youth C because he was focused on
Youth B. Youth E stated staff tried to separate the youths in the
physical altercations, but called for assistance when there were
too many for them to handle. Youth E stated he did not recall the
names of the youths in the gym and did not recall the names of
staff involved in this incident.
Youth F was interviewed on 11/20/2024 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention. Youth F stated Youth A, Youth B and Youth C
were new youths on the unit and tried to assert their dominance
by threatening to “beat people’s ass”. Youth F stated he walked
out of the gym when he heard fighting and Youth A punched him.
Youth F stated he hit Youth A back and they started to fight. Youth
F stated the physical altercation ended when unit staff and
additional staff intervened. Youth F stated he did not recall the
staff involved or the details of their interventions. Youth F stated
he did not recall seeing Youth B and Youth C being physically
assaulted in this incident.
Youth G was interviewed on 11/27/2024 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention. Youth G stated it was planned to physically
assault Youth A, Youth B and Youth C. Youth G stated Youth A
was targeted because he argued with Youth F over a pen, Youth
B was targeted because he was new to the unit and Youth C was
targeted because he was disrespectful. Youth G stated the
physical assaults occurred while the youths were waiting for the
teacher to arrive on the unit for class. Youth G stated he left the
gym and hit Youth B one time. Youth G stated he does not recall
the names of the youths and staff involved in this incident.
Youth H was interviewed on 12/26/2024 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention. Youth H stated Youth A, Youth B and Youth C
were new to the unit and disrupting the program. Youth H
4

explained that Unit 3A youths have a determined showering list
and Youth C disagreed with his name being last on the list to
shower. Youth H stated he walked out of the gym and hit Youth B
for being on their unit. Youth H stated unit staff and additional staff
intervened and the physical altercations ended. Youth H stated
Youth A, Youth B and Youth C were moved to another unit
following this incident. Youth H stated he did not recall the details
of Youth A and Youth C’s physical altercations.
Staff 1 was interviewed on 11/27/2024 at Wayne County Juvenile
Detention. Staff 1 stated she responded to an assistance call on
Unit 3A and saw Youth A and Youth B in the vestibule looking like
they were involved in a physical altercation. Staff 1 stated Youth A
had developing swollen, black eyes. Staff 1 stated she de-
escalated Youth A and Youth B in the vestibule with another staff.
Staff 1 stated she then entered the unit and found Youth E and
Youth F escalated with Youth F moving to attack a male staff.
Staff 1 stated she saw Manager with blood on her shirt and trying
to protect a youth. Staff 1 stated she began to assist staff in
verbally redirecting youths and physically stepping between
youths to defend and stop the physical altercations.
Staff 2 was interviewed on 12/02/2024 by phone. Staff 2 stated
she was looking for a supervisor when she saw a physical
altercation on Unit 3A. Staff 2 stated she saw staff running
between physical altercations as she called for assistance and
pressed the door button for Master Control to open the unit door.
Staff 2 stated she assisted in verbally redirecting and physically
stepping between youths to separate the youths once on the unit.
Staff 3 was interviewed on 12/05/2024 at Wayne County Juvenile
Detention. Staff 3 stated she responded to an assistance call on
Unit 3A. Staff 3 stated she redirected Youth E to the gym to
separate him from the physical altercations, but Youth E sat down
in a chair in the common area. Staff 3 stated when she turned
around to redirect other youths, Youth E got up and punched
Youth A. Staff 3 stated she secured Youth E away from Youth A.
Staff 3 stated there were multiple physical altercations with staff
redirecting and intervening in each one.
Staff 4 did not return calls placed on 12/02/2024 and 12/12/2024.
Staff 4’s interview on 12/19/2024 did not occur as planned due to
an unforeseen situation at Wayne County Juvenile Detention.
Staff 4 wrote an incident report that is summarized in the
documentation section of this report.
5

Supervisor Trainee was interviewed on 11/27/2024 at Wayne
County Juvenile Detention. Supervisor Trainee stated he
responded to an assistance call on Unit 3A. Supervisor Trainee
stated he saw youths punching and kicking each other, blood on
Manager’s shirt and Manager being pulled to the ground by a
youth. Supervisor Trainee stated he assisted in separating the
youths and called for sanitation workers to clean up the unit.
Supervisor Trainee stated Unit 3A youths were reassigned to
different units following this incident to prevent future altercations.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed on 11/27/2024 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention. Supervisor 1 stated she responded to an
assistance call on Unit 3A. Supervisor 1 stated she saw multiple
youths swinging at each other. Supervisor 1 stated she assisted
by moving Youth A and Youth B off the unit to the vestibule for
their safety.
Manager was interviewed on 11/13/2024 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention. Manager stated she responded to an
assistance call on Unit 3A and found multiple physical altercations
occurring. Manager stated Youth A got behind her to walk to the
vestibule, but Youth E jumped over the couch and hit Youth A
before Youth A left the unit. Manager stated she fell to the ground
with Youth A and multiple youths fell on top of them and hit them.
Manager stated Youth F pulled her out from under the youths and
she then got Youth A to the vestibule.
Video
11/05/2024 Unit 3A video from multiple camera angles were
reviewed. Video does not record sound. Video shows multiple
youths in the gym around 9:05 AM. More than the top half of the
front wall and the side walls of the gym are windows, which allows
staff to see into the gym. A staff stands behind the staff desk
facing the gym. Youth A and Youth B sit at a table in the common
area in front of a television. Youth C sits on a couch behind the
table and flips through a small book. 9:16 AM Youths start exiting
the gym. 9:17 AM Youth C gets up and walks several steps. A
youth, who walked out of the gym just prior to Youth C getting up,
strikes Youth C in the head and continues to strike Youth C as
Youth C goes to the ground. A staff intervenes as other youths
exit the gym and hit Youth C. The staff stands between Youth C
and the other youths to deflect the swings away from Youth C.
Another staff runs to address a physical altercation involving
Youth B. Two youths leave the gym and approach Youth B. One
youth taps the back of Youth B’s head and Youth B sits up (head
was down and resting on his arms on the table) and the other
6

youth strikes Youth B’s head. Also at this time, Youth A gets up
from the table and is struck by youths who left the gym. Additional
staff arrive at 9:18 AM and verbally redirect and physically
intervene to separate youths from fighting. Youth A moves to the
corner and Youth B moves to the opposite corner of the same
wall. Youth A and Youth B attempt to protect their head and body
with their arms and face the wall as youths attempt and strike at
them with hands and feet. Staff physically intervene by shielding
Youth A and Youth B and physically moving youths away from
Youth A and Youth B. Manager and Youth A fall to the ground
while youths strike at them. A youth pulls Manager to a standing
position. 9:19 AM Youth A is in the vestibule. Video does not
capture Youth B placed in the vestibule and Youth C entering the
meeting room. Video cameras did not show Youth A, Youth B or
Youth C going to the gym or speaking with the youths in the gym
prior to the physical altercations. Video does not show Youth A,
Youth B or Youth C engaging in conversation with each other.
Video footage does not show Youth A, Youth B or Youth C fighting
back with the youths.
Documentation
Wayne County Juvenile Detention Unit 3A on 11/05/2024 had 14
youths and two staff working the unit.
Staff 4, Staff 7 and Supervisor Trainee wrote incident reports
dated 11/05/2024. Summary of incident reports state Youth B and
Youth C declined the request to play basketball with the youths in
the gym. The youths came out of the gym and started physical
altercations with Youth A, Youth B and Youth C. Assistance was
called by Staff 7. Staff separated and removed youths from the
unit to end the physical altercations.
Nursing progress note dated 11/05/2024 states Youth A was seen
after a physical altercation. It states Youth A is injured with his
right eye red and swollen, dime size bump in the middle of his
forehead, redness on the left side of his face, superficial scratches
on both sides of his neck and on his right shoulder and redness on
his right upper arm. It states Youth A’s scratch marks were
cleaned and bacitracin applied. It states Youth A received Motrin
and an ice pack. It states Youth A’s pupils were equal and reactive
to light. It states Youth A was ambulatory with a steady gait and
asked and answered questions appropriately.
Nursing progress note dated 11/05/2024 states Youth B was seen
after a physical altercation. It states Youth B’s injuries are bruising
to his right and left eyes and a scratch on his left hip. It states
7

Youth B was given an ice pack and his scratch was cleaned and
bacitracin applied. It states Youth B does not have dislocations or
deformities.
Nursing progress note dated 11/05/2024 states Youth C was seen
after a physical altercation. It states Youth C denied dizziness, but
complained of headache and nose pain. It states Youth C was
given Tylenol and an ice pack. It states Youth C was not observed
with visible injuries, dislocations or deformities.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance for responding promptly to the
multiple physical altercations on Unit 3A on 11/05/2024.
CONSULTATION
In addition to line of sight, staff should place themselves in the
same area (i.e. in the gym with youth) or within hearing distance of
the youths for closer monitoring.
Conclusion VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
Rule Code Program statement.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care, safety
and supervision methods for addressing residents’ needs,
implementation of treatment plans and discharge of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Allegation 1
Staff made inappropriate comments about the assault when the
youth's parent inquired about safety measures to protect their
child.
Allegation 2
Youth D alleges Staff 5 and Staff 6 taunt him and Youth F about
their pending charges.
Investigation Allegation 1
Interviews
8

Youth A’s father was interviewed on 11/25/2024 by phone. Youth
A’s father stated he visited Youth A on 11/06/2024 at Wayne
County Juvenile Detention and observed Youth A with two black
eyes. Youth A’s father stated he spoke with Case Manager and
asked what happened to his son. Youth A’s father stated Case
manager said, “You do realize this is jail and he is going to get
beat up. If you’re worried about him getting beat up, come bail him
out”.
Case manager was interviewed on 11/20/2024 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention. Case manager stated she told Youth A’s
father and every parent she meets that they can pick up their child
if the child has a bond that is paid. Case manager denied telling
Youth A’s father that Youth A would be physically assaulted
because Wayne County Juvenile Detention is similar to a jail and
assaults happen in jail.
Allegation 2
Interviews
Youth D was interviewed on 11/20/2024 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention. Youth D stated Staff 5 and Staff 6 taunt him
and Youth F about “getting football numbers.” Youth D explained
the phrase means they would receive double digit numbers for
years in prison for their pending charges.
Youth E was interviewed on 11/20/2024 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention. Youth E stated he did not have concerns with
Staff 5 and Staff 6. Youth E denied witnessing Staff 5 and Staff 6
taunt youths.
Youth F was interviewed on 11/20/2024 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention. Youth F stated Staff 5 and Staff 6 “talk crazy”.
Youth F stated Staff 5 and Staff 6 taunt him and Youth D about
receiving “football numbers”, which means receiving double digit
years in prison for their pending charges.
Youth G was interviewed on 11/27/2024 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention. Youth E stated he does not have concerns
with Staff 5 and Staff 6. Youth E denied witnessing Staff 5 and
Staff 6 taunt youths with the phrase “football numbers”.
Staff 5 and Staff 6 were interviewed separately on 12/19/2024 at
Wayne County Juvenile Detention. Each denied using or knowing
the meaning of the phrase “football numbers”. Each stated never
using the phrase “football numbers’ with youths to reference how
many years in prison will be served for their pending charge.
9

Documentation
Wayne County Juvenile Detention Code of Ethics policy and
procedure 3.1 under Staff/Youth Relationships states “Staff
members shall not “roughhouse” or verbally “horseplay” with
youth. These actions can be misconstrued and can lead to anger
on the part of the youth or worker.”
Analysis Allegation 1
The agency is found in compliance because there is not enough to
support that Case Manager inappropriately addressed Youth A’s
father’s concern for his son.
Allegation 2
The agency is found in compliance because there is not
conclusive evidence that Staff 5 and Staff 6 taunt the youths with
the amount of time they will do for their pending charges.
Conclusion VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules.
